text:
Many organizations have a whole new set of
applications that are driving requirements for

increased capabilities and performance at the
edge of the cloud, or even beyond the edge of the

network. For many customers this means bringing
AWS cloud computing capabilities to the edge.

Running applications in disconnected
environments and connected edge locations can

be challenging because these locations often lack
the space, power, and cooling needed for data

center IT equipment. The AWS Snow Family of
devices are used to help customers that need to

run operations in austere, non-data center
environments, and in locations where there's a

lack of consistent network connectivity. AWS
Snowcone is the smallest member of the AWS

Snow Family of edge computing and data transfer
devices, weighing in under 5 pounds with 8

terabytes of usable storage, 2 CPU, and 4 GB of
memory. Snowcone is small, approximately 9

inches long by 6 inches wide by 3 inches tall, and
supports operation via battery for mobility. Snowcone is

portable, ruggedized, secure, and purpose-built
for use outside of a traditional data center. Its

small form factor and light weight design makes it
a perfect fit for tight spaces or where mobility is a

necessity, allowing Snowcone to deploy virtually
wherever you need it. Snowcone devices use

tamper-evident and tamper-resistant enclosures,
with two layers of encryption in transit and at rest.

Snowcone is designed to meet stringent
standards for ruggedization, including free-fall

shock, operational vibration, and more. When
sealed, the device is both dust-tight and water

resistant. The device also has a wide operating
temperature range from freezing to desert-like

conditions. Customers use Snowcone in
backpacks on first responders, for content

distribution, in tactical edge computing use cases,
in healthcare and industrial IOT scenarios, for

transportation, logistics, and autonomous
vehicles, and even in drone use cases. Like other

members of the AWS Snow Family, customers
can use Snowcone to collect, process, and move

data to AWS and run edge computing workloads
that use AWS IoT Greengrass or Amazon EC2

instances. To setup and manage Snowcone, you
can use AWS OpsHub, a graphical user interface

application for Snow family devices, including Snowcone,
enabling you to rapidly deploy edge computing workloads

and simplify data migration to the cloud. With
Snowcone, you have options to best fit your data

movement needs. Utilizing the innovative E Ink
shipping display which acts as a touch screen

during operation, you can ship the device with
data to AWS for offline data transfer, or transfer

data online with AWS DataSync. At the edge, you
connect to the device over Ethernet or Wi-Fi, and

access its storage using NFS. Once the data
transfer job has been processed and verified,

AWS performs an erasure of the device that
follows the National Institute of Standards and

Technology guidelines for media sanitization.
You can order Snowcone with just a few clicks in

the AWS Console. Get started with AWS
Snowcone today for your computing and data
transfer workflows at the edge.
